alert.note: Alert for Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Prince of Wales Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 6:16PM AKST until January 16 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION SNOW EVENT CONTINUING INTO THE NEW WORK WEEK... .As a system positions itself across the northern gulf, moisture is being steered into the Panhandle, with widespread precipitation enveloping the north and central areas. Through the day warmer temperatures have penetrated inland, with many observation sites rising a few degrees by Monday afternoon. Expect snow ratios to continue drop as snow becomes wetter and heavier. As the front moves southeast Monday afternoon it will bring accumulating snowfall to the southern Panhandle. For the north, expecting accumulating snowfall to end sometime Monday night, with clearing moving north to south through the day Tuesday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM MONDAY TO 3 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Prince of Wales Island and Ketchikan Gateway Borough. * WHEN...From 3 PM Monday to 3 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

area.areaDesc: Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Prince of Wales Island
